- [b]Great[/b] story, deeply thought out and merges all previous bioshock storylines into one end. 
- Gameplay wise it's feels the same as the previous games, but the story makes up for that 101%.

If you are planning to buy it, get the "BioShock: The Collection" for €20,- (Which includes all the DLC) on currently on Steam and start playing with Bioshock 1 => Bioshock 2 => Bioshock Infinite since the story continues on the previous series.

After you finish this game, you'll feel empty inside, and you'll want to immediately start it all over again, so you can relieve this amazing adventure. The game worth its prize, it gives you way more than you pay. 
There are books everyone should read, movies everyone should watch, and this is one of the games everyone should play.

Gioco emozionante! Se state cercando una storia avvincente in grado di coinvolgere e far riflettere questo è il posto giusto. I temi trattati spaziano dalla religione, vista sia come strumento di oppressione che come speranza, alla teoria del multiverso e il problema della scelta. Ci si immedesima facilmente nei panni dei protagonisti, che risultano ben caratterizzati, in grado di provare emozioni autentiche. I colpi di scena si susseguono e riescono sempre a stupire. Un vero capolavoro, che non dimenticherete una volta arrivati i titoli di coda. Anche dal punto di vista artistico, alcune atmosfere tolgono il fiato! Dal punto di vista del gameplay è comunque valido, ma direi che non è quello il punto forte.

Uno de los mejores juegos de su genero en aquel año.

Simplemente: Una Obra Maestra

Jedna z mála her, ze kterých se pro mě staly opravdu unikátní kousky. Úžasné prostředí doplněné o propracovaný příběh, který v některých ohledech, které v průběhu hraní děsivě vyplívají na povrch, navazuje na předchozí díly této série. Hru bych doporučil opravdu všem, kterým nevadí úkoly typu "jdi tam a přines tamto, pak budeš moci jít zase jinam"... Tyto úkoly se tam sice vyskytují, avšak obávám se, že bez nich by příběh nebylo možné vyprávět tak skvěle, jak se to tvůrcům této hry podařilo.
l'ambuance et l'histoire son juste génial, un jeux qui na pas pris une ride! <3
Fun gameplay, good story. All around good game

Великолепная игра.... 10/10...
Simplemente una obra de arte, la continuación de Bioshock 1

Изначально не был заинтересован в этой игре из-за мультяшного стиля графики и сеттинга Америки начала 20-го века. Купил с большой скидкой. И был поражён: сюжет интригует с первых минут и заставляет идти дальше по уровням без остановки. И концовка по эмоциям и послевкусию равноценна концовке Башенного Цикла С. Кинга. Элизабет просто как персонаж великолепна, а как напарник ... такого нет нигде.  Великолепное сочетание механик шутера и "сверхестественных" способностей. Прокачка оружия и менеджер экипировки - золотая середина для FPS: разнообразит игру, но не отвлекает от основного процесса. 
Много я понаписал эпитетов, но это действительно мои впечатления об этой игре.
Единственный минус - сложно умереть даже на высокой сложности))) Надо непойми чем заниматься, чтобы тебя убили. Но после боёв придётся побегать за аптечками и патронами, а то дальше точно прикончат. И есть места, в  которых для прохождения с первого раза нужно продумать действия, полнаставить ловушек...
Удивительная игра! Сбалансированый и динамичный геймплей, захватывающий сюжет, великолепный визуал. Нельзя поставить 10 из 10 потому что искусство не мерится цифрами.
Очень шикарная сюжетная линия, так же отличный шутер.

Amazing game, stunning visuals.

Bioshock Infinite is not just an entertaining shooter but also a story-driven adventure that perfectly captures the essence of the series. Game mechanics allow for creative solutions to battle (not as deep as Deus Ex but closer to Dishonored). It also works as a perfect closure to what remains today as one of the most interesting mysteries out there. Although it does play well as an independent game, the game does have something to do with the previous entries although most of this is explained via DLCs, which are key to closing the Rapture narrative from Bioshock 1 and 2. The story may seem a little weird or confusing at times but is worth the investment. Other than that, the game itself is entertaining and visuals hold to this date.
Великолепная игра со своей атмосферой ))))))))))
best game ever

Es un verdadero juegazo. Me gustaría decir muchas cosas, pero es el claro juego que se debe jugar sin que te expliquen nada. Pero bueno, algo sí puedo decir.

En las dos primeras entregas de la saga estamos en una polis sumergida en el océano, mientras que en esta parte, salimos del mar y nos vamos hasta el mismo cielo. Ese cambio me pareció bastante curioso, y supieron jugar muy bien con ese factor a través de los elementos que nos vamos encontrando durante la historia (railes, dirigibles, etcétera). 

También me gusta mucho nuestra acompañante, me parece un personaje maravilloso con una evolución brutal como la trama de la historia. Y como se comportan todos los personajes entorno a ella, detalles insignificantes o que interfieren en la historia, te dan muchas pistas que hasta el final no son comprendidas.

Tanto en gráfico como en audio es arte. A mí me sorprendió muchísimo y me enamoré completamente del OST.

Y qué decir del final, solo que ha sido uno de los que me hizo pensar durante un rato.
Maravilloso
Bioshock Infinite. Simply play it.

[b]If you haven't played the original Bioshock, go buy and play that one first! Stop reading this review and get it. It's cheaper than this. Or, since at the time of writing it's the Black Friday 

I nominated Bioshock Infinite for the "The No Apologies" award 2017, because of what it means to me. 

To quite a few people, it's not the best Bioshock game. And fair enough. But I'm willing to look past the flaws because the good parts, to me, make it very compelling. I've got 68.2 hours in this game, and about 40 of those hours are from the DLCs. The other 28 were me playing through the game multiple times.

So, here's the thing. A lot of people list pros and cons, but in reality, this is the third (or second, if you exclude Bioshock 2 since it was made by a different team) installment of the Bioshock series. So many of the things you've come to expect are gone, which can make a "Con" list turn into "This isn't in Infinite but was in the original".

Such as: [b]Guns.[/b] You can only have two guns at a time, rather than 8. The guns are less inventive, too, if that bothers you. It's a selection of pistols, machine guns, grenade launchers, rocket launchers, and carbine-type weapons.

[b]Vigors.[/b] This one actually DOES annoy me. Vigors feel superfluous in Columbia compared to Plasmids in Rapture. While you can imagine uses for Vigors, they don't really have the same feeling of necessity.

[b]The location.[/b] Personally I really love how open Columbia is, though I do wish it were less linear. A more sandbox-y Columbia would be phenomenal; the current one is somewhat-linear. I have seen complaints from some people who wish we were still in Rapture, or that it was darker and more claustrophobic (I don't mean that in a bad way, either), like Bioshock or even the System Shock games of which Bioshock was a spiritual successor.

[b]Gene Upgrades.[/b] You can no longer choose upgrades for different Plasmids to put into slots. Now, each Vigor has a preset number of upgrades that you can buy whenever you come across a machine that sells them. There's also no more Power to the People machines to upgrade guns, but there's upgrade machines for guns, too, and each gun has a preset number of upgrades similar to Plasmids. 

HOWEVER! In their place, something which is worth mentioning, we have Gear. Gear are pieces of equipment that are hats, shirts, pants, or boots, and they do different things. Things like reload faster, gain greater control over movement when riding on a Skyline, create a shockwave when jumping off a Skyline, killing enemies with melee restores HP, etc. These pieces of gear are found at preset places in the story, but the ones you find are randomized. These items are never massive bonuses, but they can at least change how you play. Are they the same as the old, more modular system? I'd say no.

[b]Ammo types.[/b] Relatively-small thing, but there's no longer ammo types. Every gun only has standard ammo. If you liked being able to switch to Armor-Piercing rounds to take out Big Daddies, there's no more of that.

[b]ADAM.[/b] You buy everything with money. Vigors, vigor upgrades. Gear is found, never purchased.

[b]A talking protagonist.[/b] Booker DeWitt talks. You can hear his voice in the trailers, but he speaks throughout the game, though that is partly because he has a companion to talk to along with others.

I think these are the main complaints levied against Infinite, but as I said above, I'm willing to look past them because the scope of the game and its story are much more compelling to me than Bioshock's. The things I listed aren't necessarily issues depending on what you liked about Bioshock. The reality is that while Infinite is by no means the game it could've been (Seriously, you can look up on YouTube "What Bioshock Infinite could have been" and see what they cut), what we got is still an interesting, visually-appealing experience.

One last thing I want to mention: I only mentioned things have a problem with. If you want more of a Bioshock game and none of the things I mentioned bother you, or you're willing to look past them, I obviously recommend this game.
